definition[0]: an escape from a prison, especially one involving a lot of prisoners
definition[1]: a very successful product, especially one that comes after a company has produced some less successful ones

definition[2]: more detailed information referring to part of a set of figures
example[1]: The report gives detailed breakouts of wage changes.
example[2]: Oil prices were on the edge of a major breakout, but turned down in late trading.
